original:
The evolution of architectural thought has been significantly influenced by its philosophical underpinnings. In this context, the aesthetic-creation theory of art, as articulated by philosopher Zangwill, provides a framework for understanding how art is produced. Zangwill characterizes this theory as "artist-based," emphasizing the role of the artist in the creation process.
